title: Giardiasis
summary: Giardiasis is a parasitic disease caused by Giardia duodenalis (also known as G. lamblia and G. intestinalis).[3] About 10% of those infected have no symptoms.[1] Individuals who experience symptoms may have diarrhea, abdominal pain, and weight loss.[1] Less common symptoms include vomiting and blood in the stool.[1] Symptoms usually begin 1 to 3 weeks after exposure and without treatment, may last two to six weeks or longer[4]
